1553312221221122112221122112112111.content:
Warning. Still a psychopath.

As you approach the doors leading into the main meeting room of the Capitol, you make a small mirror in your hand. You just need to check your tie, that's all. Once you finish perfecting your tie knot, you open the door to your new Council. Each of the 75 people in the room, stood up and cheered, giving you a standing ovation worthy of a perfect Broadway performance. This event was also being televised on Supernia national TV, channel 86. One moderator stated that 80% of the TVs were on this channel. It seems that the people want to meet their government. As you approach the back of the room, you notice Julian and Leo sitting on either side of a large chair. You sit down in the comfortable chair, making it your throne. "Welcome to the first Council meeting! You may be seated. Let's begin with introductions. Each person will introduce themselves, state what they represent, and state your power/powers. For example, I am Johnathan Anderson, President Anderson, or Lord Anderson. Outside of this country, I am known as The Fallen God, due to my power. I control what's known as the Deity force, which in summary, gives me God-like power over matter, life and energy. I also have many other powers that would take me a very long time to list. As you may know, I am President of Supernia. I also will not hesitate to eliminate anyone who I feel deserves it. Luckily for you, it takes a lot to get on that list. Anyway, that's me. Who's next." You finish and sit down. The room erupts into loud applause. "Can we hold the applause until the end?" You ask. The applause stops.

"I guess I'm next. I'm Julian Anderson..." (I'm sparing you guys the trouble of reading 75 of these bios.)

2 hours later...

"Now that that's out of the way, let's govern." You begin. "The first issue on the table is the creation of a Supreme Court. We need judges. I'd say have one from each province, and one from the council. That will make 15 people. Seem fair? There are buttons on your desk for voting."

After a minute, the anonymous vote came in, and was unanimously in favor of the court. "Okay, we need justices then. Each province will have an election to decide who will represent them. Meanwhile, for the Council Justice, I nominate Seymour Flannery. He's currently in charge of the Bureau of Law Creation and Regulation. After he speaks, anyone who would like to nominate anyone else may come up. The nominee can decline the nomination, and will not be in the running for the position." This meeting lasts another hour, and it makes a Judiciary and sets production standards.

"Thank you for your time. That will be all." You say as you close the meeting. You get up, shake the hands of many of the officials, and fly back to your palace. After some time, Julian arrived at the palace. "Hey Julian. What's you think?"

"I think it went well." Julian responded while holding a small green fireball.

"What's the fire for?" You asked.

"I think it'd be a good idea to make some fireworks to celebrate the creation of the country!" He replied. "With the colors we could create together, it could be nice!"

"Not now. Besides, April 18th will be our independence day. Not April 21st." You say. "Besides, it could be a liability."

"My lord!" A guard interrupts.

"What is it?" You thrash. This is never good.

"There are some people who would like to speak to you. They were not thrilled about the events that transpired in New York a couple days ago!" He responds.

"I'll be right down." You sneer. You just wanted to have a nice afternoon. Walk around the city, go to a restaurant, find a girl to date. Normal teenager things. But that will have to wait. You take off your suit and put on your costume. The familiar blue aura surrounds your body. Your icy blue eyes start to glow as you shoot a beam into the sky off your balcony. You're angry. "Ready Julian? Your about to witness something special."

"Ready." He laughs evilly as he finishes putting his costume on. He shoots a beam of green fire parallel to your laser. "Let's go."

You walk into the grand hall of the palace, and notice a group of 5 foreign diplomats. "Hello and welcome to Supernia. I am The Fallen God to you. I run this place. This is my brother, Blaze. What brings you to my country?" You ask in a very proper manner. You don't want any violence, yet.

"Well, we're here to discuss the fact that this land mass did not exist a week ago. Plus, considering the advanced infrastructure, something had to have happened. We just want to know what happened." One diplomat requested.

"Seems simple enough. The City of Power, a city created to be a safe haven for supers was just getting too cramped. So I flew over here and created this!" You respond, suggesting that you created the country, which you did.

"I'm sorry, created?" Another diplomat responded curiously.

"Yes. What part of God did you not understand. I have power unmatched by anyone and anything. Do you have a problem with that?" You respond playfully. You like taunting.

"Do you mind demonstrating this power you have? I'm a very skeptical person." The first one asked.

"Of course. Just stand here." You point to a spot on the ground. "I promise I won't hurt you. I only hurt those who have wronged me and my people." The group walk to the spot you pointed out. You create a small glass box around them. "This will be your transportation. Blaze, come with me." You, Julian and the box of people lift up into the air. You then fly over to an uninhabited island. You scan it for life, and notice that it's just an uninteresting rock in the middle of the ocean. "In five minutes, that island will not exist." You say to the terrified diplomats. "What's the matter? Scared of heights. Here, have a front row seat!" You lower the box so that it is next to the island. "I promised that I wouldn't hurt you. Don't worry!" You laugh as you point your finger at the island. A small blue glow forms at your fingertip. "Boom." You say as a beam of energy fires from your finger, annihilating the island. The box of people was completely unscathed. "I told you. No injuries!" You laugh at the terrified expressions on their faces.

"HOLY SHIT!" One screams.

"I told you it wouldn't exist soon. I don't lie often!" You laugh. "Now I can do a lot of other things too. For instance, I've proven able to destroy planets, and my brother can make fires stars would be jealous of. Anyway, any other requests?"

"Yes, can you get us back on ground!" One yells.

"Sure." You, Julian and the box fly back to Supernia. You touch down, and get rid of the box. The five all collapse. "Stuart!" You yell. One of the guards comes over. "Can you find a place for these five to recuperate?"

"Yes my lord." The guard replies. You carefully picked your guards. They are some of the most powerful supers in the world. But they know what would happen if they tried to mutiny. That's how you keep them in line.

2 hours later, the diplomats wake up. "Rise and shine!" You taunt. "So, why else are you hear?"

"Well, seeing how you are a sovereign nation, you need representation in the rest of the world's politics." One diplomat started.

"But do we really. Last I checked, you didn't want us." You interrupt. "Plus, we are entirely self-sufficient, isolated and neutral to the rest of the world. All we want here is a society where supers are treated as people. In fact, I've been trying to get the world's supers here. I estimate that we have about half of them here."

"The thing is that some don't want to be part of your nation. They do not like your ways. For example, how you destroyed London a while back." One diplomat added.

"Well, they can deal with that themselves. If they do not want to join me, that's fine. And I don't want to join you." You insist.

"If you don't join us, then you will not be able to enter any other country." Another diplomat adds.

"Oh. Some people may want to see friends left out of here. Then, I'll just have to make some trips to some countries." You suggest.

"What do you mean?" One diplomat asks with a growing feeling of uneasiness.

"It's simple. I'll have a civil conversation with the leaders of other countries. Allow access to my citizens, or feel what it's like to be that island." You laugh. "I only tease. I would destroy the country. However, it wouldn't be pretty."

"Okay. Anyway, can you let us go now?" One diplomat plead.

"Go, and never drop by unannounced again. Tell that to your organization. If they surprise me again... well, the island I destroy will be inhabited. Bye." You grin. Once the diplomats were gone, you turned to Julian and said, "See Julian, sometimes threats are what you need to get through life. Now, I want to have a relaxing afternoon."

"Let's meet some citizens." Julian suggested.

"Great idea. I need some casual clothes anyway. Let's go shopping." You suggested. You and Julian both go to your respective parts of the palace. You personally have a suite the size of a large house. It includes a kitchen, living room, rec room, practice room, master bedroom with walk in closet and en suite bathroom, a guest room, and more. You put on a t-shirt, jeans and sneakers. You look just like a normal 16 year old kid. You want to be incognito. But, if people recognize you, oh well. They all love you. Plus, what could they do to you? You're a God among men. You wait for Julian in the main parlor. He's in a similar outfit to you. However, he looks nowhere near as good as you.

"Bro, I just noticed something different about you." Julian said.

"What?" You ask, genuinely confused.

"Well, you seem more, built." Julian responds.

"Oh. I get it!"
1553312221221122112221122112112111.title: And Life Goes On

choices: Two girls come up to them to talk.  (Romantic interests for them.)
15533122212211221122211221121121111.content:
"Oh. I get it! Remember when the U.N. tried to imprison me, and I escaped easily. Well on the way home, I met Leo, and he suggested to buff myself up to look more intimidating. It seems to have also affected my appearance." You explain.

"Ah, because you look great!" Julian adds. You make a mirror appear in front of you, and look at the contours of your face. You do look quite sexy. Plus, with your buffed up muscles, you look like a model. Slim, muscular and toned. You look like a model. "Meanwhile, I'm a twig."

"Well Julian, that can change." You laugh as you buff Julian up to look great as well. His arms fill in the sleeves on his shirt. He grows to an even 6', 2 inches shorter than you. He's not quite as big as you, but you knew Julian didn't want to be huge. Just handsome. And boy was he. You both could pass off as fitness models. "Let's meet some fans." The two super teens walk out of the palace, and are swarmed with press. Everyone wants an interview with the 2 most powerful people in their country. (You, the reader, may be wondering where Leo is in all this. After the meeting, John gave him a vacation.) "People. Not now. If you want an interview, you'll need to contact me privately!" You yell. "Same goes for my brother, or anyone in the Council. I just want to have a relaxing afternoon!" When you finish, you create a small force field around you and Julian, pushing away the reporters.

"Much better. I need space to breathe." Julian laughs.

"Yeah. Anyway, where to go." You wonder. "How about Go Figure? They have some nice stuff!"

"Sure." You and Julian walk to the store, talking about your plans for the future, and about how you'll convince countries to allow Supernia passports. Thirty minutes of walking later, you arrive at the clothing store. As you walk in, you're greeted with many stares.

"Are those the Anderson Brothers?" One clerk yelled.

"Oh my God, they are!" A woman screamed. Soon, the whole crowd rushed towards you and your brother. However, your personal space force field proved extremely effective.

"People, act civilly. We just want to buy clothing. Relax!" Julian yelled. "Anyway, I need some more jeans, shorts and t-shirts. I'm good on more formal and warm clothing. Meet you at the register."

"See ya Julian." You wave goodbye. You head over to the shorts section. You outgrew all of yours a while ago.

"Hello Mr, and welcome to Go Figure. Can I help you with anything?" A saleswoman asked.

"No thank you. However, if I do need something, I'll make sure to find you again." You respond politely.

"Okay." She walked away. She looked disappointed. She really wanted to help her President. You look through the shorts, eventually finding the style you were looking for. You head to the changing room, and put one of the pairs on. Unfortunately, they were too big. You overestimated the size of your waist. Thankfully, you grabbed other pairs. You put the next size down on, and it fit perfectly. Plus, they made your muscular legs look great. You flexed your calves, and approved of your selection. You grabbed more in the size you needed, and headed to the athletic wear. You grabbed some work-out shorts, and went back to the changing room. As you entered, you took off your shirt and shorts, and tried on the shorts. You wanted to see what you would look like while you worked out in your normal fashion. Needless to say, you looked fantastic. You flexed your 8 pack abs, and ran your finger along the ridges of the muscles. You looked perfect. You changed back into your normal clothes, grabbed the rest of the clothes you needed to buy, and met Julian at the counter. You rung up the clothes on one bill, which came out to be 800 credits. (The credit has strength equal to the pound for contextual reasons.) You paid, and left the store.

"Hey John, have you figured out teleportation yet?" Julian asked, carrying all his bags.

"Why do you ask?" You respond. Your levitating your bags telekinetically.

"Well, these bags are inconvenient. Can't you just teleport them back to the palace?" He answers.

"I don't think so. I can make teleporters, but can't teleport myself. Weird, right?" You laugh. "Let's just fly."

"Sure." The two teens fly up and land on their balconies. They put their bags in their rooms, dressed in nice clothes, and met at a fancy restaurant.

"Hello, and welcome to Cafe Italiano. Will it just be you two?" The hostess asked.

"Yes." You respond.

"A table for two will be ready in ten minutes. Please feel free to get a drink at the bar, or sit in our waiting area. What name shall I put you under?" She asked.

"Cooper." Julian responds.

"Thank you."

"Why Cooper." You ask.

"I want to be incognito. What do you think would happen if she yells out Anderson in a crowded restaurant?" Julian explained.

"Good point." The two teens head over to the bar. While your actually 16 years old, you changed your appearance and maturity to be that of a 25 year old. Same goes for Julian.

"Hello, would you two gentlemen like a drink?" The bartender asked.

"Yes, I would like a glass of Pinot Noir." You respond.

"I would like a Gin and Tonic." Julian responds.

"Okay." The bartender leaves to make the drinks. All of the sudden, something happens to the Anderson brothers. What is that something?

----------------------------

Rules for continuing this story.

No gratuitous sex/erotic images. I want to keep this PG-13.
Julian and John are idealistically identical, so do not make them fight, unless it's a play/practice fight.
Julian is an extremely powerful pyrokine. He is also capable of flying at supersonic speeds, is super strong, and super durable. Keep powers consistent.
John's powers were all previously mentioned in other chapters. If they exist in other chapters, you can use them. I'm trying to make his inability to teleport a joke, so no teleporting. If you want to add a power, make sure something happens to trigger the development of this new power.
Try to keep their personalities consistent.
Try to keep the story consistent.
I've been trying to instill some morality on John. but, if you want to make him more moral, do it slowly.
Make sure your chapters have creative titles, and make sure they have substance.
Unless you have two vastly different options for continuation or a clear path you want to follow, add a Reader's Choice option. Don't be shy. Also, don't end the story.
Finally, make sure you write it with correct grammar and spelling. Be coherent.
If you are unsure of anything, just e-mail me!
15533122212211221122211221121121111.title: And Life Goes On, Part II

choices: Actually screw the character limits.  Anyway, continue...
155331222122112211222112211211211111.content:
"Johnny? Is that you?" Someone yelled from the other side of the bar. You turned around and noticed one of your friends back from London.

"Stephanie? I wasn't expecting you here." You laughed as you got up to hug her. Since you were exiled from England, you hadn't seen any of your friends or family, aside from Julian. Stephanie was a 23 year old girl (Even though the events that transpired in this story have all happened over a couple of months at most, I'm just pretending that this makes sense. Go along with it.), about 5'6" tall. She was a very pretty girl with long, brown hair, and piercing hazel eyes. You did not know she was a super too, seeing how most people tried to keep that secret back before you created a nation for them. "I didn't know you were a super too! What's your power?"

"I can stretch very far, almost like my body was elastic." She responded. (Think of Mr. Fantastic or Elastigirl from The Incredibles) "And I know what you can do."

"Yeah, some people are just born overpowered." You joked. "Have you ever met my brother?"

"No I haven't. Stephanie Barteau." She introduced herself to Julian.

"Julian Anderson. Pyrokine and brother of John." Julian responded. You laughed at the way he introduced himself.

"We have some serious catching up to do!" You said to Stephanie. "I'll be back." You walked away and requested to change your table size to four. The hostess said that it's okay, but will take an extra 10 minutes. You're fine with this. "Okay, we have a table for four now."

"Perfect." Stephanie smiled. "Oh, and Julian."

Julian perked up. "Yeah?"

"I have a friend who'd like to meet you. She's also a pyrokine." Stephanie smiled.

"Interesting. This relaxing dinner seems to have become a double date." You laughed.

"Hey Diana! I have someone who you's be interested in!" She shouted. Soon, her friend appeared in front of the group. "Julian, this is Diana."

"Diana MacGowen, nice to meet you!" She extended her arm for a handshake. She's a bit shorter and more curvy than Stephanie. Her hair was fire-red. She spoke with a Scottish Accent. Unlike you, Stephanie and Julian, she's from Edinburgh, not London.

"Julian Anderson. Nice to meet you too." Julian finished the handshake.

You all talked to each other, learning about how power discovery, interests, and other things you'd talk about on a date. After about 15 minutes, the hostess yells, "Cooper! Party of 4!"

"That's us." You sprang up. "We used a fake name so we wouldn't cause an uproar." You laughed.

"Smart." Stephanie smiled. The hostess led you to your table. It's right by the window. You and Stephanie sit on one side of the rectangular table, and Diana and Julian sit on the other side.

"Buonasera." A waiter said. "I am Sergio, and I will be waiter tonight. Could I start you off with something to drink?
"Could we have water for the whole table?" You ask. "And could I have another Pinot?"

"Of course. Anything else for anyone else?" Sergio asked.

"Water is fine with me." Julian responded.

"Same." Diana said.

"Could I have some Seltzer water?" Stephanie asked.

"Of course. I will return momentarily." Sergio said. After he left, everyone at the table grabbed their menus and looked for what they wanted to eat.

"What do you want to start with?" Julian asked.

"How about Calamari Fra Diavolo?" Diana suggested.

"Yum!" You reacted. "Let's share that!"

"I'm vegetarian, I'll just get a salad." Stephanie muttered.

"Don't worry Stephanie. We don't judge." Julian laughed.

After that, Sergio return with the drinks. He put them on the table and asked, "Are you ready to order?"

"Yes, can we share a Calamari Fra Diavolo, and could I have Veal Parmigiana?" Julian asked.

"Of course. You Miss?" Sergio responded, motioning to Diana.

"Could I have the Pappardelle with Wild Boar?" Diana asked.

"Of course. You Miss?" Sergio responded, motioning to Stephanie.

"Could I start with a Caesar Salad, and could I have the Spaghetti Primavera?" She asked.

"Of course. You Sir?" Sergio responded, looking at you.

"Could I have the Linguini ai Frutti di Mare?" You asked.

"Of course. I will bring bread shortly." Sergio said and left.

You took your water glass, sipped and noticed that it tasted funny. You then notice that when Sergio was pouring the water, there was lemon in it. You hate lemon. "Guys, the water is really lemony. Like, lemonade lemony." You said. "Anyone want some lemon removal?" You ask.

"Me." Diana responded. "I hate lemon."

"Okay." You take the water glasses, and remove the lemon juice from the water using your powers. (How else?) "There, no more lemon." You take a sip of the now lemon-less water. "Much better."

Two hours later.

"That was a great dinner guys!" Diana shouted.

"We should do this more!" You laugh.

"I agree. Anyway, I have to get home. I told my mom that Diana and I wouldn't be out long." Stephanie said.

"I'll walk you home." You responded.

"Okay. See you Diana! See you Julian!" Stephanie shouted at the other pair. As you start walking, Stephanie asked, "Was that a romantic date, or an outing with friends?"

"Depends. Which would you have rather it been?" You responded smiling.

"Then that was a fantastic date." She smiled. "And you'll be a fantastic boyfriend."

"Aww, you're making me blush." You laughed as you went in for a kiss. She understood the gesture and your lips connected. "And you will be a fantastic girlfriend."

Oh my god! He's nice, hot, powerful, and strong. He's so perfect! Stephanie thought. You overheard this thought and smiled. She loved you, and you truly loved her. You also noticed her trying to grab your arm. You flexed your 18 inch arms, and she squeezed the rock-hard muscle. "Johnny, your so strong."

"It's part of my powers." You laughed as she continued to hold your arm. "I can do a lot of things." Stephanie giggled as she took your hand and held it firmly.

"We're almost at my place. Come in! Meet my parents." She suggested.

"Okay." You smiled as you approached the door. Her house was in one of Regina City's suburbs. It was a moderately large suburban home. As Stephanie unlocked the door, you notice the "Wipe your paws" doormat sitting in front of the door. "Have any pets?"

"Yeah. I have a cat. Her name is Selena." Stephanie responded. "I'm just warning you, she's very playful, and will not hesitate to jump onto you."

"I have a cat too. Well, my brother has a kitten. He's one of those Fireproof cats Xavier's sells." You laugh. "I love him to death."

"Then I'm sure you'll be fine." Stephanie laughed. As she opened the door, she yelled, "Mom! Dad! I'm back. There's someone I'd like you to meet!" Mr. and Mrs. Barteau rushed into the living room. "Mom, Dad, this is John Anderson. We used to be friends back in London. We just met up at Cafe Italiano, and now we're dating."

"You should have asked us before becoming a couple, but I approve." Mrs. Barteau started. "Oh, where are my manners. Coleen Barteau."

"Johnathan Anderson. Just call me John though." You introduced yourself.

"Wait, aren't you the president? Why are you out like this unguarded and..." Mr. Barteau started.

"I still just want to lead a normal life when not governing. Plus, I'm all the protection I need." You answered.

"Sorry. I'm Lucien Barteau." Mr. Barteau finished. "What brings you to our house?"

"Well, my brother and I decided that after that meeting today on TV, that we just wanted to have a relaxing dinner, so we went to Cafe Italiano. That's where I ran into Stephanie. We knew each other back in London, but we had not seen each other in a very long time. We caught up and just hit it off. As we were walking home, she asked if that was more of a friendly get together, or a date. I just replied that it was which ever one she wanted it to be. And at that moment, we became a couple." You explained.

"Well, isn't that romantic." Mrs. Barteau joked. "I think you two are adorable with each other!"

"I agree." Stephanie laughed.

"Just remember who your dating Stephanie. This is the president." Mr. Barteau said.

"What does that have to do with anything?" You asked confusedly.

"Well, you may have to be away a lot, doing presidential things, working, etc." Mr. Barteau explained.

"Don't worry. If other leaders can function with a family, why can't I." You said, defending yourself.

"It's just that dating is a big commitment. I'm not against you dating my daughter. It's just that I don't want her to feel lonely." Mr. Barteau added.

"As I said, I know what I'm doing." You defended yourself again. "Plus, she'd never get lonely if she lived with me in the presidential palace." When you said that, Stephanie's eyes lit up with desire. You knew once you said that, opinions would change.

"Hang on. We need to talk a bit. Just discuss this with Stephanie." Mrs. Barteau said.

choices: You wake up to greet Stephanie waiting for you in front of the palace.
1553312221221122112221122112112111111.content:
"Okay." You responded. As the Barteaus left the room, you knew that there was no way they could say no to Stephanie living with you. There was obvious mutual love between you two, and it would solve the problem of longing for the other. While waiting, you entertain yourself by playing with some fire in your fingertips. You watch the small blue flame dance around your fingers, careful to not waft any smoke into the fire alarm. After a couple of minutes, you dismiss the fire from your fingers, and try something else. Hey Julian? Come in Julian! You thought. You and your brother share a telepathic connection.

Yeah? What's going on? Julian responded.

We may have another resident of the palace. You stated

Yeah, I'm having the same conversation with Diana. We decided to be a couple. Julian laughed.

Yeah, same. Stephanie's parents are discussing letting her live with me. She's an adult. She should be able to decide herself! You raised your mental voice.

I'd say that if they don't let her, argue. But don't get violent. I know your temper. It's bad. Almost as bad as you'll look lashing out at her parents. Julian suggested.

Okay. They're coming back. See ya. You finished, calming down.

"Okay, we'll let Stephanie live with you, as long as we can check on her and visit every so often." Mr. Barteau explained. He loved explaining. Your smile grew even bigger.

"Thank you Mr. and Mrs. Barteau. I'll take good care of her." You said playfully.

"Please, call us Coleen and Lucien." Mrs. Barteau insisted.

"Okay. It's been great meeting you!" You said as you left. Stephanie needed some time to pack, so you decided that you'll pick her up tomorrow. It is now 10 P.M. You just met the love of your life, who loves you back just as much. Your brother also has fallen in love, and you've figured out how to live a normal life.

As you exit the house, you noticed that a car was heading towards you. It stopped next to you, and a man walked out of it. "My Lord! What are you doing here at this hour?" He's one of your guards.

"I told you I was going out tonight. I was just dropping my date off at her house. Relax!" You explained. "And before you ask, Julian is doing the same."

"You don't understand. Something's going on, and we need you at the palace. NOW!" The guard explained further.

"Well, I was about to fly there, until I was interrupted. Just go away." You dismissed him, as you fly to the palace. You land in the front garden, and notice more foreign diplomats. "I told you not to drop by unannounced. How difficult is it to let me know a day in advance?" You scowl.

"This is an emergency. Aliens have landed in the north pole, and want to know who destroyed a planet they were looking for as real estate. They found evidence pointing it to you. They want to speak to you." One quickly explained.

"Okay. I'll meet them, and I'll deal with them." You agreed as you put on your costume and flew due north.

In no time, you noticed a large spaceship parked on an iceberg, and many aliens walking around it. "What do you want?" You yelled at them. One, presumably their leader, came up to you and started speaking an alien language. "Hang on." You tried to use your powers to learn their language. Thankfully, you could understand any language. "Okay, what do you want?" You ask in their language.

"You destroyed the planet of Zephof, is this correct?" The alien asked.

"Could you describe this planet to me?" You asked.

"Yes, it was uninhabited, and had an atmosphere made entirely of Sulfur Dioxide. Our planet is dying, and we were going to move to that planet. It was the only planet inhabitable by our people within 100 light years. Then, when we went there earlier, it was gone!" The alien explained.

"Okay. So I may have destroyed it testing my power. But, I remade the planet!" You stated.

"Yes, but with the wrong atmosphere. It now has Sulfur Hexafluoride. We need dioxide." The alien explained.

"Okay, I'll be right back." You flew over to where you tested your powers before, and found the planet. Sure enough, it had an atmosphere of Sulfur Hexafluoride. You used your powers to change the atmosphere to Sulfur Dioxide, and left a small present on the surface. A little I'm Sorry gift. Just some art. You then fly back to Earth. "Okay, the atmosphere is Sulfur Dioxide now. Happy?"

"Not quite. We're still angry with you." The alien answered.

"WHY?" You yell angrily. The blue aura around your body glowed brighter.

"Well, you prolonged our ability to move off our planet long enough to have half of our population die!" The alien screamed.

"Well, I can fix that by killing the rest of you!" You laugh maniacally.

"That's not necessary. Men, tell everyone on Zenith that Zephof is safe. I'll handle this one." The alien explained. One of the aliens used a messaging system to tell his planet that it's safe to leave. "Everyone leave. I'll be right behind you."

"No you won't. You underestimate my power." You laughed again.

"And you underestimate mine." The alien took out a blaster and shot you right in the stomach. The energy blast exploded when it made contact with you, making a huge smoke cloud. "And that's that."

"Are you sure?" You laughed as you emerged from the cloud unscathed. "Peekaboo." You aimed your finger at him and shot a laser through his body. As he fell down dead, the other aliens turned around to attack.

"You monster!" They all yelled.

"He instigated the fight. I just won." You smirk as a crowd of 100 aliens rushed towards you. You create a force field around them, trapping them inside with you. "So, everyone stop." You use your telekinesis to hold each alien in place. "Now, who wants to die first?"

"I'll avenge the death of our leader!" One alien yelled.

"Oh boy! A competitor. This should be fun!" You laughed. You sense that this one is stronger than the leader. You also notice that this one, similar to you, created a force field around himself. "Interesting. You can make these too! I'm impressed." You taunted. "Now, when it comes to force fields, their effectiveness is not always perfect. They have what's known as a pulse rate. It's measured in Hertz, or pulses per second. The more pulses, the harder it is to penetrate. Now, your field has a rate of around 50 kiloHertz. Pretty nice. Mine currently around you, has a rate of 1 octodecillion yottaHertz (1*1081.) To put that in perspective. For every time yours pulses, mine will pulse more than yours would if it was up for as long as the universe existed and will exist. That's my strength compared to yours. Anyway, hit me! As hard as you can." The alien attacked you with an energy blast, which created a large explosion. "Next time, try harder." You continued taunting. "Try again. I want to feel something by the end of this. In fact. All of you! Attack me at the same time. As hard as you can. I want your race's last stand to be something I can remember. The aliens all hit you with force great enough to destroy a planet, condensed into the confines of your force field. All the aliens were panting, considering they used all their energy trying to kill you. "You know what, that was a nice try!" You laughed. "However, nothing compared to what's about to happen to you." You took the first alien, converted his body into a star, added mass equivalent to a galaxy to it, and collapsed it, creating a hypernova inside of your force field. All of the aliens were vaporized by the blast, while you were unscathed. The explosion was the strongest the universe ever experienced, and you caused it. You cleared the force field of all the matter you used, and flew off to the planet you just fixed. "Yeah, I'm not sorry." You aim your laser eyes at it, and destroy the planet. Then you find the next closest planet inhabitable by this race, and destroy it using an energy blast. "Never mess with a God." You then flew back to Earth, sent the alien technology to researchers, and flew back to your palace. "Everything's under control." You laughed. Nobody knows what you've just done. "They were just trying to settle a misunderstanding. Anyway, next time something comes up, let me know in advance. I don't like surprises like this."

"Okay Fallen God." One diplomat said.

"You know what, that name sounds more like a title. Call me My Lord or God." You suggested.

"Fine then, My Lord." Another diplomat said.

"Now let me go to sleep. I've had a long day." You yawned as you flew up to your balcony, took off your costume, and showered. "God I love being God." You say, looking at yourself in the mirror. You then put your pajama bottoms, and fall asleep shirtless in your king sized bed.
1553312221221122112221122112112111111.title: A Very Long Day, Part 2

15533122212211221122211221121121111111.content:
Warning, "Adult Content" warning for mild sexual undertones. They're not too bad. Enjoy!

"Rise and shine bro!" Julian yelled. "Come on. Are you still tuckered out from wiping out an entire alien race?"

"To answer your question, yes." You yawned. "What time is it?"

"8:30." He answered. "Why, going somewhere?"

"No. Stephanie said she would be here at 10-ish, so I just want to know how long I have to get ready." You explained.

"Well, see you down for breakfast," Julian said as he left your room. After 10 minutes, you finally mustered the energy to sit up and walk to your bathroom, where you preceded to wash your face, comb your hair, and do other things to get rid of your terrible morning face. Once finished, you put on a nice pair jeans and a polo, and went downstairs to eat breakfast. There were three main rooms for dining in the presidential palace: The large dining room; meant for parties and other large gatherings, the private dining room; meant exclusively for your closest friends and family, and finally, the kitchen, which only has a small four person table. The kitchen is mainly used for quick meals. This meal took place in the kitchen. As you walked into the kitchen, an aroma of omelets filled the room. "Bro, you're just in time. Eddie over here just finished making some killer omelets. They have cheese and bacon and onions and peppers and.."

"I see. Don't mind if I do!" You interrupted your brother. You grabbed a plate and put an omelet and a waffle on it. Then, you sat down at the table, across from your brother, and started eating. "So when's Diana coming?" You asked with a mouthful of food.

"Oh, she'll be here at noon. She had to take care of some things." Julian responded.

"Oh, so soon!" You added excitedly. "Oh crap."

"What?" Julian inquired.

"It's already 9:15!" You stammered.

"Relax bro, you still have 45 minutes. What could you possibly still need to do?" Julian asked jokingly.

"I need to get ready." You replied nervously.

"What needs to be ready? You're dressed nicely, your hair is fine, what else needs to be ready!" Julian yelled, again jokingly.

"I wanted to get her something, and I still need to!" You facepalmed.

"Oh.." Julian's expression completely changed. "Good luck with that now."

"Yeah." Your nerves grew even more. You begin to panic. After a couple of minutes deep in thought, you figured it out. "I know, I'll order tickets for a show online!"

"Now that's using your noggin" Julian smiled. "Now finish your breakfast before it gets cold."

"Okay, mom!" You laughed.

"Whatever did happen to mom?" Julian asked.

"I don't really know. She was away on business when I blew up London, and I know she's not a super. My only guess is that she's with dad in someplace that isn't London, seeing how it's currently a crater." You answered.

"I'd believe it. Still, she's family, and she wasn't super against the fact that we had powers. No pun intended." Julian responded.

"I am curious. I think it's better if we stay out of their life, seeing how I kind of blew up their place of residence, most of their belongings, and way of life." You suggested, feeling an iota of regret for blowing up the city.

"I know, I just kind of miss them," Julian said, becoming slightly emotional.

"I have an idea. When I'm traveling to all the countries convincing them to allow safe travels for Supernia passport carriers, I'll find them, alter their memories, give them some powers and let them join the nation. They'll still remember that we're their kids, will always think that they had powers, and were always waiting for the right moment to leave wherever they are to join us here!" You suggested.

"God you're smart." Julian laughed.

"I know." You laughed. "Well, I'm done. If you need me, I'll be waiting for Stephanie."

It's 9:30 in the presidential palace. You left the kitchen, ran up to your room, brushed your teeth, and ordered tickets for the show you wanted to take Stephanie to. After that, you went to the foyer, where you could wait for Stephanie in peace. Meanwhile, Julian, still in pajamas, was finishing a bowl of cereal. After he finished it. He went to his room, took a quick shower, put on some rather nice clothing, and prepared to meet Stephanie at the door. By 9:50, the brothers were both ready to greet their newest resident of the palace. "Hey bro?" Julian started.

"Yeah?" You responded.

"I was curious as to when you were planning on doing your international voyage to convince countries to let us in." He said.

"Well, if you must know, I was going to do that next week. I want to get Stephanie situated here before going off. Plus, it'd be weird to invite someone to live with you, and then immediately leave for God knows how long." You explained.

"Ah, I was just wondering. That's all." Julian began. He immediately started snickering.

"What's funny?" You asked smiling.

"I find it kind of funny whenever one of us says God, like, God knows what or Oh My God." He snickered.

"Why?" You asked.

"Because you've been playing God for a couple of months now, and I'm pretty convinced it's not playing anymore." He continued.

"Oh, I get it. You're calling me God, aren't you?" You asked playfully.

"Yeah. I guess I am." Julian answered, still snickering.

"Well, I basically am God, so it makes sense." You laughed as you reminisced about wiping out that alien race for annoying you.

"My lord, there is someone at the door for you." One guard told you.

"Okay, here I go Julian." You said, pumping yourself up for your big moment.

"Knock her dead, but not literally," Julian responded, joking about the sheer amount of power you possessed. You opened the large front doors, and noticed Stephanie with a lot of bags.

"Johnny!" Stephanie let go of her bags, making sure none hit the ground too hard.

"Stephanie! I've been waiting so impatiently for you." You smiled as you ran for a hug.

"Johnny, can you help me with my bags?" She asked, holding your muscular arms.

"Of course Stephanie." You replied with a giant smile on your face. You looked at the bags and used your telekinesis to lift them all at once. "Ready for the grand tour?"

"I am Johnny." She responded excitedly.

"Okay, I'll meet you in the foyer in a couple of minutes. Let me just put your stuff upstairs." You lifted yourself up and flew yourself to your balcony, where you unlocked the door and deposited the baggage in the room. You then walked over to the call system, whereupon you called the butler to put away Stephanie's things. He said that it will be ready within the hour. You then walked back out on the balcony, relocked the door, and flew to the foyer.

"So Julian, you look good," Stephanie said.

"Yeah, Diana and I really hit it off last night, and she's going to live here too!" Julian responded happily.

"Oh, Johnny never told me that," Stephanie responded excitedly.

"Yeah, he wanted it to be a surprise. But I just had to spill the beans." Julian laughed.

"MROW!" Samantha meowed.

"Stephanie, I hope you like cats, because this one is a rascal." Julian laughed. "Meet Samantha. She's one of the fire-resistant cats that they sell at Xavier's."

"I actually have a cat at my parent's place. But she's technically my parent's cat. So she's still there." Stephanie explained.

"Hello guys. I see you've met Samantha." You laughed as you picked her up. "Samantha can be a real rascal. She likes to show up in places you'd never expect."

"Believe me, I'm used to it." Stephanie laughed. "Anyway, I'm ready for my tour."

"Okay. The Anderson Tours tour of the Presidential Palace is not departing. Please keep you hands and feet inside the vehicle at all times." You started as Stephanie laughed. "Our first stop is the kitchen." You and Stephanie left to go on your tour, leaving Julian and Samantha alone in the foyer.

One hour later.

"We have made it to our final stop, the bedroom. Thank you for choosing Anderson Tours." You finished.

"Thank you Johnny." Stephanie hugged and kissed you, causing you to blush.

"Aww, anyway, what do you think of your new home?" You asked.

"Well, it's a bit small, don't you think?" She laughed.

"You're a funny one, aren't you." You laughed. "Anyway, make yourself at home. Oh, the one thing is that gym negates some powers, most notably super strength, speed, and stamina. It gives a better workout that way."

"Okay, good to know." Stephanie made a mental note of that, not that it mattered to her. "Anyway, what's for lunch. I'm hungry!"

"I was going to wait for Diana and Leo to get here before lunch, that way we could all have it together." You explained. "They should be here in an hour. If you want a pre-meal snack, then there's some in our suit's kitchenette. I'm just warning you it's all stuff I like. We need to get food for you too." Stephanie walked over into the kitchenette as you were saying that, and made a small discovery.

"Are these cheese balls?" You heard.

"Yes. I have an addiction to them." You answered.

"I LOVE CHEESE BALLS!" Stephanie screamed.

Yeah, she's a keeper. You smiled as you thought that. You two were a perfect match. "Don't eat too many. We have a great lunch planned!" You yell at her. "Save some for later!"

"Okay!" She responded.
15533122212211221122211221121121111111.title: Two's Company, Five's a Party

155331222122112211222112211211211111111.content:
So... While this may be a weird time to do it, I'm going to make a character bio for you, John Anderson. If you have no interest in this, you can go to the bottom and choose the Lunchtime chapter option. I just really wanted to write this.

You are John Anderson, a technically 16 year old super human. However, you've aged yourself to be 25. So, in reality, you're 25.

Physical:

You are approx. 6'1", 220 lbs, with a strong, ripped, athletic build. You have a slightly tanned skin tone, with dark brown wavy hair. Your face is still slightly boyish, but with enough maturity to be "sexy". People, especially Stephanie, find you extremely attractive/sexy. You also have one brother, Julian, who is very similar to you in build, personality, and looks, just a tad smaller.

Mental:

You're personality is very complicated. You are slightly psychopathic, feeling no remorse for killing the millions you have. You feel that super-humans are superior to those without powers, and should not have the authority to control any aspect of their lives. You also have a very short temper, and could go on a rampage just from a little provocation. However, you're working on it, and have gotten better. Whenever you fight, you have a huge ego, mainly because you know there is nothing anyone can do to stop you. You love taunting your enemies before annihilating them. Sometimes, you even let them attack, which you know won't do anything to you. You'd never hesitate to kill your enemies. They rarely leave a battle with you alive. Aside from your psychopathy, you are a kind guy in a relationship. You have strong connections with all your super friends and family, but became detached from your parents, mainly because they're not supers. You hope to be able to remedy that during one of your presidential duties.

About You:

Powers... You have a large multitude of powers, and it seems that you have more out there. You just have to unlock it. However, at this time, you can still do a lot. Besides your signature power of manipulating matter at a Planck level, (Planck is the smallest possible. You can manipulate all matter). You can take an atom, and change its element, create your own elements with your own properties, create and destroy matter, and even absorb matter to use for later. You can also change any objects physical and chemical properties. For example, you can make air poisonous without changing the elements in the air. Basically, you can do anything to anything or anyone. You are completely invincible and immortal, and it takes a lot of damage for you to even feel pain. An explosion you created stronger than any other in the universe did not even come close to damaging you. You can survive in any condition your put in, whether it be the vacuum of space, underwater, in a volcano, or even in a poisonous gas. Nothing can harm you. You also have extensive knowledge of chemistry, and can learn the chemical make-up of any object. You know every property of every element, isotope, ion and compound, and can use that knowledge for your matter manipulation. Aside from that, you are capable of lifting 7.45 * 1031 pounds, or 17 Suns, running/flying at speeds of 100 Light-years per second, and not (and never) teleportation. (It's a running joke that John cannot teleport.) In terms of attacking, you can use your matter manipulation to make your enemies into elements you can weaponize. Your favorite method of killing is creating a small star, collapsing it, creating a supernova inside of a force field, vaporizing everything, and then destroying all the matter made in it. Speaking of force fields, you can make them with pulse rates of 1 * 1081 Hz. A pulse rate measures how strong the field is. The more Hz, the stronger it is, because it is harder to penetrate. You have an easy time penetrating all force fields weaker than 3 YHz, (3*1024 Hz) In this universe, force fields are considered impenetrable when their pulse rate is greater than 1 MHz, or 1,000,000 Hz. To your knowledge, the only person that can create force fields of a strength strong enough to stop you is yourself. Not even Leo can. You also have unlimited power over energy similar to your power of matter manipulation. You can create energy blasts, beams, and pulses, all strong enough to destroy whole solar systems. You also can use laser vision, heat vision and cold vision, all strong enough to destroy large planets. You also can steer your beams and energy attacks. For example, you can make your laser vision go through a maze, and come out the other side to blow something up. Other powers include telepathy, reading a person's past, lie detecting, biomancy (creating life), all types of kinesis (Control fire, metal, telekinesis, etc.), and the power to change people. Give powers, take them away, strengthen, weaken, change looks, personality, and any other part of a person. You also have a super suit that makes you 100x stronger. It is made of an indestructible element you created able to withstand literally anything. It also creates a sinister blue aura surrounding your body, making you look as though you are visibly radiating power. The fire you create, dubbed Demon Fire, and all energy/laser based attacks you have are this blue color as well. Your suit also has the blue color, in the form of blue streaks down the black armor-like suit. It is very mobile, and feels almost like a second skin, but gives off an extremely intimidating vibe. However, even after all of that, you can't use your powers forever. You have limits, and stamina. If you ever strain yourself too much, you can fall into a coma. However, sometimes, this coma can strengthen you. You still (somehow) have untapped potential, and at some point, will break past limits and flat out become a god. However, the title you've given yourself, The Fallen God, makes you believe you are God already. However, when I say become a god, I mean omnipotent ruler of the heavens and universe kind of power, not your kind of power currently. But, you are the closest thing to a god the universe has at the moment, and are continuously getting closer. You also are incapable of having your powers suppressed by anything not created by you. So if someone tries to put you in a setting where all powers are nullified, yours will not be unless you want them to be. When they are, your powers obviously go away, and your physical strength is that of a normal non-super's. You are still strong naturally, though not super-humanly strong. Just above average.

You are the president of Supernia, a country you created to be a safe haven for supers. You live in the presidential palace with your girlfriend, your brother and his girlfriend, your advisor Leo, and servants/guards. Your servants and guards call you "My Lord", while all regular civilian's regular reaction is to call you Mr. President. You also have a net worth of 100,000,000,000 credits, which is the currency of Supernia. One credit is equivalent one British Pound. When you go out, you just want to act as a normal guy, and people usually respect that. You don't like the special presidential treatment. You only like the power it gives you. However, despite your hunger for power, you are not corrupt, and will always do what's best for the country.

You speak with a British accent, and are very patronizing toward those you feel are inferior to you. Otherwise known as non-supers. You also have an addiction to cheese balls, and love cats.

That's John in a nutshell! Anyway, if you want to continue the plot, be my guest! The link to the next chapter is below.
155331222122112211222112211211211111111.title: Pre-Chapter Thing

1553312221221122112221122112112111111111.content:
Warning. Strong language and violence ahead. But you're probably used to that by now...

"So, what do you think of the food?" You asked, shoving a bite of steak into your mouth.

"John, you never cease to amaze me." Stephanie smiled, toying with her salad. "First the palace, now the food! What more could there be?"

"The cat?" Julian butted in, laughing. "Speak of the devil, here she comes!" With perfect comedic timing, Samantha ran into the dining room, chasing a toy mouse. She ran under the eight person table, through all of the chairs, and finally back out. "Cats will be cats."

"Truer words have never been spoken." You laughed. "Although more redundant words haven't been said either." Everyone, except for Leo, started laughing.

"Leo, is something bothering you?" Julian asked. "You seem awfully quiet."

"Yeah." He replied with a bit of a pout. "Something that happened during my vacation. I'd rather not talk about it, and don't try your telepathy."

"Okay. I'll let you have your privacy." You agreed. "Just remember that if you want to talk about it, I'm almost always available." A long, uncomfortable quiet fell upon the room. It seemed as though everyone ran out of things to talk about. After a minute of quiet, a tall, slim man walked out of the kitchen. He was a middle aged man, wearing all of the clothing you would expect of a chef.

"Was the lunch to your liking?" He asked with a slight Spanish accent.

"Yes. It was delicious!" Diana smiled, breaking the discomfort.

"Would you like dessert?" He continued.

"Of course!" She exclaimed. "I hope it's chocolate."

"Eddie, could you stay a couple minutes before you continue? I want you to meet our new residents." You said, catching his attention.

"Of course My Lord." Eddie responded.

"Eddie, this is Diana MacGowen and Stephanie Barteau." You started. "Stephanie, Diana, this is Eduardo "Eddie" Alvarez. Personal chef to my closest friends and me."

"Pleasure to meet you." Eddie formally stated.

"The pleasure is mine." Stephanie smiled.

"Thank you very much Eddie." Diana said at the same time.

"Tell us a little about yourself Eddie." Stephanie suggested with a curious look in her eye.

"Well, I born in Chile, where I first learned of my powers." He started. "I found that I was able to change any choice I'd made in the past hour. After finding this, I realized that being a chef would be a rather lucrative career. If the food didn't come out right, I could change what I did to it. Last year, back in the City of Power, I opened a small restaurant that mainly served traditional Spanish, Mexican and other Latin cuisines. One day, I heard that there was someone very important in the restaurant. Sure enough, when I looked into the dining area, I saw Lord Anderson ordering food. This restaurant wasn't fancy, or upper class or anything, so I was shocked to see someone as important as him here! When I got his order, I made sure it was perfect. A couple of minutes after the waiter delivered the food, I heard that Lord Anderson wanted to see me. I was terrified. Every bad thought possible raced through my head as I wondered why he wanted to meet me. For some reason, the correct thought never made it through though. I still remember exactly what you said to me that day. 'Sir, this might have been the greatest meal of my life. There is no doubt in my mind that I will be here again.' I almost fainted. In fact, I'm pretty sure the only thing that kept me conscious were Lord Anderson's powers. Immediately, word got around that my restaurant was Lord Anderson's favorite restaurant, and we got swarmed with patrons. Eventually, I was asked to be Lord Anderson's personal chef. I couldn't say no, could I? Since then, I've expanded my culinary spectrum, and I've been indebted to Lord Anderson ever since."

"You forgot one detail." Julian interrupted. "The fact that your restaurant is now one of the most popular destinations in Regina City!"

"That is also true." Eddie laughed. "My sous chef, who has a very similar power to me, took over the restaurant, and changed nothing but its size. I'm sure that if you go, you'll get a discount. Now if you'll excuse me, I have some dessert to prepare." When he finished, he gave a slight bow, and rushed back into the kitchen.

"Well, now you guys know Eddie. If you want anything to eat, he's the guy to ask." You laughed. "My favorite thing about him is that you never know what he's going to make next."

"In one meal, you can sample the cuisine from all of Western Europe." Leo said, starting to regain his composure.

"Leo! Good to see you back in the real world!" Julian laughed, visibly angering Leo.

"Julian, not now." Diana scorned. "Let's wait for him to fully recover from this experience before we make jokes, okay?"

"Okay." Julian pouted. "Sorry Leo."

"It's fine Julian."

Wow. Even I can't control Julian like that! You thought to yourself. "Anyway, desert should be coming soon. I'm excited!"

"Me too!" Diana yelled. "I hope it's chocolate!"

"Me three." Julian laughed. "John and I sometimes bet on what we think the meal will be. We're usually both wrong."

"Yeah. If we gave Eddie our wagers every time, he'd be the richest man in Supernia!" You laughed.

"Yeah..." Everyone, including Leo, started laughing. The friendly, cheerful atmosphere of the lunch has finally been recovered, only to be destroyed by something completely different.

"MY LORD!" A guard came running in. "EMERGENCY OUTSIDE! COME QUICK!"

"Hang on guys. I'll be right back." You scowled angrily as you walk up to your bedroom, put on your costume, and look at yourself before you head out. There was something different. You had the same aura, body, face, and everything. However, your irises were a bright, terrifying red. The rage building inside of you has given you an even more intimidating appearance, and you love it. After checking out you new ocular development, you flew out from your balcony and headed to the place of emergency. Immediately, you saw a large spaceship, similar to the one that the aliens you wiped out came in. "Those bastards. I thought I killed them all." You flew down in front of the spaceship, and greeted the aliens. They were very different from the ones you wiped out. "Hello, and welcome to Planet Earth. Home of 7 billion people and counting. How may I help you?" You asked like a hotel receptionist.

"Cut the crap Anderson." One alien hissed in English, surprising you.

"Oh you know English?" You asked, genuinely surprised. "The last ones didn't, or at least wouldn't speak it."

"Is that why you murdered their entire race and blew up 3 possibly inhabitable planets?" A different alien asked angrily.

"What do you mean?" You asked, taunting them this time. "You think I did that myself?"

"We don't think. We know." The first alien scowled. "Don't play dumb with us."

"Fine. Can I just know why you are here? I'm not a fan of surprise visits." You stated.

"Jonathan Anderson, you are under arrest by the Intergalactic Federation of Interplanetary Life for genocide, disrupting the peace, and 3 counts of planet destruction. Come with us." One alien off to the side grabbed your arms, and cuffed them with strange looking handcuffs, compelling the guards to come forward for attack.

"Guards, stop. I'll handle this one myself. It's personal." You yelled.

"These were specially designed for you. There's no way to escape from them." The alien putting the cuffs on you smirked.

"Okay, just take me to your fucking leader then." You scowled angrily. "Oh, Lars! Tell everyone I'll be a little late for dessert, and to save me some!"

"Got it My Lord." Lars, one of the guards outside, responded.

"What makes you think you're every going home?" The alien who arrested you asked tauntingly. "Say goodbye to Earth. You're never going to see it again."

"Goodbye Earth." You said, laughing.

"Why are you laughing, scum?" The first alien questioned.

"That's for me to know, and you to find out." You laughed as you were forced onto the spaceship.


End of Chapter
1553312221221122112221122112112111111111.title: The Arrest

choices: Continue because the character limit is a bully and it stole my lunch money
1553312221221122112221122112112111111111.content:
More violence and strong language.

The aliens were not very nice, but that was expected, considering their anger. Two aliens were in charge of making sure you behaved. They each had gun-like weapons drawn with one hand, with the other hand tightly clamped around one of your arms. Eventually, you made it to a small cell, which they threw you into. You landed with a loud thud. Deciding to cooperate for now, you didn't make any kind of struggle or show any kind of emotion. Your ruse seemed to be working. "Too easy." One alien laughed.

"It seems that The Fallen God has fallen!" The other alien yelled in your face. It was a struggle, but you maintained your composure.

"And to think that this weakling was calling himself God." The first alien continued laughing.

"Hey, I feel like I have some right to know this." You started. "Do you have any kinds of powers at all?"

"Well, considering your current predicament, I think we can talk." The first alien thought out loud.

"Yeah. I'm sure we can." The second alien agreed. "We're the strongest fighters of our race. Physically, there's nobody who can beat us!"

"Anything else? Any mental achievements to boast about?" You asked.

"Our physical might is enough for us." They smiled. "Why do you want to know?"

"I was just curious." You lied. You really wanted to know if they could read minds. Now you know that they can't, you can start planning out your next moves. "Maybe during my incarceration, we can mock fight. I'm not as weak as you'd think."

"Well, your weak enough to be captured by us." The aliens laughed.

"I guess your right." You feigned defeat. I cannot wait to kill these motherfuckers. This is going to be fun. You though. It's only a matter of time.


About 30 minutes later.

"Welcome to the IFIL." One of your alien captors said. The building was bigger than any other on Earth, and was quite imposing. "We're taking you right to the leader."

"Thank you. I wanted to speak to him anyway." You thanked. You were led through many different passages before making it to a large room. The main point of interest was a giant monitor floating in the center. Currently, it showed a picture of Earth. In front of the monitor was a group of aliens all speaking an alien language you were not familiar with. Your powers allow you to understand any language, but you have to hear it first.

"You must be Mr. Anderson." The center alien, presumably the ringleader, started. "We've been expecting you."

"Of course you were expecting me!" You shouted. "You sent for me and arrested me!"

"No need for the rudeness." The alien said calmly. "Do you know who I am?"

"I'm guessing your the president of this organization." You inferred.

"That is correct. Politically, I am the most powerful being in the Universe." The alien bragged.

"One question. Why is Earth not part of this organization?" You asked, trying to regain your composure.

"It's simple. According to IFIL regulations, a planet cannot become part of the IFIL until it makes peaceful contact with at least 3 other member planets." The leader explained.

"Okay. Earth needs to get its shit together then." You clarified.

"I guess." The leader, disgusted with your language, answered. "Now, the punishment for the kind of crime you committed would be the destruction of your planet. However, since Earth is not part of IFIL, we have no rights to do so. So, we're just going to imprison and torture you for eternity."

"Okay, can I make a rebuttal?" You asked.

"Okay, but make it quick." The leader stated.

"It'll be over in a jiffy." You laughed as your eyes changed from an icy blue to blood red. Immediately, you separated your arms, breaking the cuffs you were restrained with. "Too easy." Everyone in the room started to panic, and the aliens who were dragging you everywhere started to attack. "Everyone, just freeze." As soon as you finished, everybody in the room, aside from you, lost the ability to move, and were frozen in place. "First, let me just say this. This whole time you've had me captured, I've been playing along. Every time you called me weak, I took it. Someone as strong as me needs to be able to deal with weaklings like you. Now, to the guards who guarded my cell before, let's try out that "mock fight" that I suggested. However, this fight will be real. Let's start with you!" You smiled as you released one of the two aliens from your grasp. At first, he tried to run away, but was stopped by a force field you created. "Oh, there's no escape from this room." You laughed evilly as the alien turned to face you. "Now, I want you to hit me as hard as you can. I'm going to let you have one free shot. Let's see what your race can do." The alien rushed towards you, seeing as he had no other choice, and punched you directly in the face. He just kept punching and punching. After a minute, you grabbed his arms, stopping the punches. "You know. If your going to brag about being strong, you should tell the truth." With him immobilized, you kicked him, cutting him in half with your foot. "Ooh. That felt good. Tell me, how scared are you?"

"Terrified." The other alien who guarded your cell cried.

"Good. You should be." Your red eyes started to glow, and a strong blue beam of light came out of them, completely incinerating the alien. By the time you were done firing, the alien was nothing but a pile of ash. "Tell me, what race were they a part of?"

"The Gronids." One alien screamed.

"Where is their planet?" You demanded.

"We won't tell you! You'll just destroy it." A different alien screamed.

"I DIDN'T ASK YOU!" Your voice boomed violently, shaking everything in the room. Your blood red eyes met the gaze of the alien that talked out of turn, terrifying the alien. "You know something. I think I'm going to use a different method of killing for you." You laughed maniacally as you started to rearrange his internal organs, making his body cease to function. You released him from his frozen state to see his body fall limp and dead. "3 down, 8 to go. It's a real shame. I wanted to kill more. Anyway, he didn't let me finish. I asked you, the leader, where their planet is. For every minute you don't answer, I'll just destroy a random planet. Capisce?" You grin evilly.

"Y-y-you're bluffing." The leader stuttered, terrified.

"Am I?" You laugh, as you raise your hand. "Let's play monitor time!" You fly over to the monitor, and play around with it, finding a random inhabited planet. Eventually, you came across Haarcointh. "Ooh. Population 3,012,642,217. That's a good number to add to the total! You sir!" You pointed at a different alien. "How would you like me to destroy this planet?" You ask evilly.

"You're a monster." The alien you pointed at answered.

"That's not a method of destruction. I'll give you one more chance before I turn you into a puddle." You threatened.

"Fine, make it blow up." He answered.

"Ooh! Nice and traditional." You waved your hands in the air, making a large screen appear. "Now you get to watch! Enjoy your featured presentation." You laughed as Haarcointh appeared on the monitor. "So, I like your explosion idea, but I'm going to tweak it a little." You pointed your finger directly into the air, and smiled. "Haarcointh, you lived a good life. Goodbye." The tip of your finger started to glow a light blue, and a huge laser, the diameter of a football field was shot out into space. (It started outside, so the room was not destroyed.) The screen you created split and showed the laser travelling through space at unfathomable speeds. "I'd estimate that the laser will arrive in 15 seconds." You stated.

"Haarcointh is on the other side of the galaxy. Nothing can go that fast!" The leader yelled.

"You think I'm bluffing?" You laughed. "You'll see." Silence befell the room as everyone watched the monitor. On the side that Haarcointh was displayed, you could faintly see a blue speck approaching. "There it is! Right on cue!" You laughed happily. The laser edged closer and closer. All of the sudden, the laser and all of its glory appeared next to Haarcointh, and flew right past it.

"You missed." One alien pointed out.

"That's the twist!" You laughed as the aliens realized your actual plan. The side with the laser showed the laser hit the star Haarcointh was orbiting. The laser was absorbed into the star. For a second, it looked like nothing happened. "You know, everyone on Haarcointh probably just wished on a shooting star. I wonder what they wished for. All I know is that it won't come true." You laughed as you snapped your finger. As the sound died out, the star exploded, taking Haarcointh and 12 other planets with it. "So, where is the Gronoid planet? And don't lie. I'll know." You demanded, starting to let your anger show. Your blue aura was turning black as death, accenting the redness of your eyes.

"Oh my God! Who are you!" One alien yelled in disbelief and cowardice.

"I AM THE FALLEN GOD! KNOW MY NAME AND FEAR IT!" You boomed, making the alien who just asked that question faint. "Nope. Your waking up." You snap your fingers, instantly waking him up. "So tell me, where is this fucking planet."
1553312221221122112221122112112111111111.title: Massacre

1553312221221122112221122112112111111111.content:
More violence and strong language...

"So tell me, where is this fucking planet." You demanded.

"Okay, if you let me go, I'll pull it up on the monitor. Just promise me you won't kill me." One alien pleaded.

"Fine." You reluctantly agreed, unfreezing the alien. The alien immediately darted towards the monitor, where he started swiping through planets. "Here. Gronidia, home of the Gronids."

"Let me see." You sneered as you flew up to the monitor. "Gronidia. Dominant race, Gronid. Population, 10,549,867,332. "This is going to be a fun total." You laughed as you motioned to shake the alien's hand. "For helping me, here's a token of my gratitude." The alien walked over to shake your hand, to terrified not to obey. "Thank you." Your face grew an evil grin as the alien's hand made contact with yours. Your hand started to glow yellow, as a 1,000,000,000,000,000,000 Volt bolt of electricity shot out of your hand and electrocuted the alien, turning him into a pile of electrified ash. "You think I would keep a promise to a weakling like you? Pitiful." You laughed as you prepared to annhilate Gronidia. "This one's going to be a special destruction. Pay attention to the screen!" You continued your evil laugh as you opened your hand out wide. Then, you closed it aggressively, making a fist. As you finished, Gronidia started to cave in on itself.

"What did you do to it?" One alien cried.

"I removed everything but the crust of the planet, creating a vacuum where it's core should be. This causes the planet to implode on itself, and lose all of its gravitational pull. The atmosphere will float away, leaving Gronidia as a couple of rocks floating in space." As you explained it, everything you described happened in real time. "Lastly, I created a virus that only affects Gronids, and set it loose in the whole galaxy. Any Gronids who come to or are already in this galaxy will die immediately upon entry."

"You just committed genocide on a race because two of them annoyed you?" The leader cried, terrified.

"Yep, and it felt damn good. Now for the rest of you seven. What should I do to you..." You asked yourself.

"Spare us?" One suggested timidly. Without hesitation, you pointed a finger at him and shot him with a small laser, killing him instantly.

"Now for the rest of you six. What should I do to you..." You grinned. "Oh, I know." You smirked as you reached your hands downward. In doing so, you started your favorite method of killing. (Everything happens as you say it) "I call this move, 'Supernova'. It's fun! First, I create a force field around myself and my targets. Then, I gather up matter. Next, I create a small, but ultra dense star. Finally, I collapse it, making it explode." As soon as you uttered the word explode, the room was illuminated by an intense white light. As the light dissipated, you absorbed all of the excess matter, making the entire room appear as if that explosion never happened. The only sign that there was conflict (if you could call that conflict) was a message you wrote in your trademark blue fire. It read, "Unless you want me to destroy even more planets, do not come to Earth. John Anderson. AKA, The Fallen God." You then looked up Earth on the monitor, found it's direction and flew home.

The 50,000 light year fly was very dull. You didn't pass by anything interesting. Easily the most boring 10 minutes of your life. Once you finally made it back home, you noticed that only 2 hours had passed since you left. "Yeah, I'll never see Earth again. What a bunch of fucking morons." You laughed as you touched down on your balcony. The fly helped calm you down, so the black aura and red eyes disappeared. When you entered the bedroom, you noticed Stephanie lying on the bed, taking a nap. You didn't want to disturb her, so you quietly took off your costume, put on the outfit you were wearing at lunch, and walked to the dining room. In there you saw Leo, alone. "Hey Leo, getting an afternoon snack?" You asked somewhat innocently.

"No, just thinking. Also, we left you a slice of chocolate cake. We would've left you more, but Diana ate way more than she should have been able to." He explained.

"Thanks!" You smiled, nicely this time, and went to get the cake and a glass of milk. When you reentered the room, you noticed Leo looking a little like he did at the beginning of lunch. "Is something wrong?" You asked.

"Get Julian, then we'll talk." Leo answered.

Julian? You asked telepathically.

What's up? He replied.

Dining room. Now. You said. In the blink of an eye, Julian appeared in the dining room. "So Leo, Julian's here now. What do you have to say?" You asked, making sure not to sound demanding, which was pretty difficult considering your recent adventure.

"While I was on vacation, I traveled to many places. While I was in Edinburgh, I saw two people who looked an awful lot like you." He started. "I figured out that they were your parents."

"What? You found our parents?" You said, trying not to cry. "No matter how powerful I get, I can't hold back the guilt I have for leaving them. I need to see them immediately."

"There's something you should know about them." Leo continued. "They were leading a rally against super people. I don't think they are aware that their son is the leader of the supers."

"Really? They've turned against us?" Julian asked. "This isn't possible!" At this point, Julian couldn't hold back the tears. "John, we're going to Edinburgh right now. We need to talk to our parents." You had no response. "John? Remember our plan? You'd give them powers, wipe their memories, have them live here. We can finally rebuild our family." Still no response. "JOHN! LISTEN TO ME!"

"Julian, I need you to be quiet right now. I have to think." You said, struggling to hold back the tears. Unfortunately, the combination of the lack of time between the aliens and this, and your disbelief made your pool of rage overflow. Your eyes started to turn red. Leo, seeing this, left the room in fear. You didn't bother stopping him.

"John?" Julian asked, concerned. "Are you okay?"

"You know what Julian? I'm not fucking okay!" You yelled, crying. "Our fucking parents hate our existence! Why do they deserve to live here? Why do they deserve me giving them powers? Why do they deserve anything?"

"They're still our family. Aside from the 5 of us, we have nothing!" Julian said, trying to reason with you. "We need them. People without parents or parental figures always end up as horrible people!"

"And I'm not horrible?" You asked. "I've destroyed 3 completely inhabited planets! I killed over 14 billion people today! That little excursion made my rage, the rage you're currently witnessing, overflow. I'm a monster! And you know what? I don't mind!"

"John, I understand how you feel. Maybe we shouldn't give them powers, or let them live here, but we should still talk to them!" Julian pleaded with you, crying. "We shouldn't take revenge! Remember that Luke kid? (Tying this with the Imagine Matrix story line) He went completely insane. We had to lock him up! After some time, we were able to stabilize his mental condition. John, just calm down."

"Why shouldn't we kill them? They hate us. They'd want the same for us!" You cried.

"Because the reason why Luke went insane was because he killed his mother, and felt nothing." Julian explained. "John, I don't want you to go down that path. Think of me. Think of Leo. Think of Stephanie and Diana. Think of Supernia! If you go insane like him, you could destroy everything you love. Deep down, I know you still miss them."

"Julian, I. I." You couldn't finish your sentence. You just slumped down and cried in your brother's lap. "I can't go now. I need some time to sleep this off."

"We don't have to go now." Julian smiled, trying to cheer you up. "I know that if they saw how far you've come, deep down, they'd be proud."

"Okay, if you say so." You cried.

"John, eat your cake. It'll make you feel better." Julian said. You picked up a fork, and slowly started eating the cake. With each bite, the redness in your eyes faded slightly.

"This is so good." You muttered, the tears slowly stopping. "You know, I think you and Eddie just saved the city of Edinburgh."

"John. Next week, do you think you'll be able to see your parents?" Julian asked.

"Yeah. Tuesday, let's go to Edinburgh." You replied, finishing your milk and cake.

"Sure! Now, tell me about your excursion." Julian suggested, curiously.

"Well, here's what happened..." You told Julian the story of what happened in space, the red eyes and the black aura. "Yeah, so it seems that I get even more powerful with anger."

"Well, most people are like that." Julian started. "Even when regular, non-super people are angry, they become strong enough to do things they would not normally be able to do."

"Either way, I like it." You laughed. "It looks fucking awesome, it's intimidating to my enemies, and a warning to my friends to get away. I'd say it's a win-win!"

"Yeah. Although your blue eyes are better looking." Julian laughed. "Red eyes won't get you any ladies."

"Speaking of which, I need a nap. I think I'll join Stephanie. See ya!" You said, your episode seemingly over.

"Have a nice nap. See ya at dinner!" Julian yelled to you.


End of Chapter
1553312221221122112221122112112111111111.title: Aftermath

1553312221221122112221122112112111111111.content:
BEEP BEEP BEEP! BEEP BEEP BEEP! The alarm clock beeped.

"You know, I really need to change that alarm. It's quite possibly the most obnoxious thing ever." You growled, trying to wipe the sleep from your eyes.

BEEP BEEP BEEP! BEE! You finally stopped the beeping.

"Maybe wake up to some music." You said to yourself. "Anyway, I've got to get ready." You got out of bed, took a shower, and put on your clothing for the day. You decided to go for a burgundy polo, some dark, stone washed jeans and sneakers. After you finished putting on your clothes, you walked down to the kitchen, where breakfast was being prepared.

"My Lord, what would you like for breakfast today?" Eddie asked.

"Could I have some pancakes?" You asked. "With chocolate chips? I need it."

"Certainly. One breakfast coming up!" Eddie smiled as he started preparing the pancake batter. After about a minute, Julian made it to the kitchen. He was wearing a t-shirt from a concert he went to with Diana, a pair of blue jeans, and sneakers.

"Julian. Right on time!" You smiled. "Today's the big day!"

"I know." Julian smiled back. "Excited?"

"Yeah." You replied. "I just hope everything goes well. I don't want to destroy another city..."

"That would be a problem!" Julian laughed. "Eddie? What's on the menu?"

"Depends on what you want!" Eddie yelled back.

"I'll have what John's having then." Julian replied. "What are you having?"

"Chocolate pancakes." You answered with a grin.

"Yum!" Julian exclaimed happily. "Keep those away from Diana though. She's a bit obsessed with chocolate."

"I noticed..." You laughed, waiting for you breakfast.


5 Minutes Later.

"Breakfast is served. Would you like anything to drink?" Eddie asked.
